Definition: from {{h2372}}; a vision; vision.
from {{h2372}}; a window; light.
from {{h2342}}; a (round) dance; dance(-cing).
the same as {{h4234}}; dancing; Machol, an Israelite; Mahol.
or מְחִיּיָאֵל; from {{h4229}} and {{h410}}; smitten of God; Mechujael or Mechijael, an antediluvian patriarch; Mehujael.
apparently a patrial, but from an unknown place (in the plural only for a singular); a Machavite or inhabitant of some place named Machaveh; Mahavite.
from {{h2328}}; an instrument for marking a circle, i.e. compasses; compass.
from an unused root meaning to enclose; a harbor (as shut in by the shore); haven.
feminine plural from {{h2372}}; visions; Machazioth, an Israelite; Mahazioth.
from {{h4229}}; a stroke, i.e. battering-ram; engines.
the same as {{h4288}} in the sense of removal; a pan for live coals; censer, firepan, snuffdish.
from {{h2846}}; properly, a dissolution; concretely, a ruin, or (abstractly) consternation; destruction, dismaying, ruin, terror.
or מׇחֳרָתָם; (1 Samuel 30:17), feminine from the same as {{h4279}}; the morrow or (adverbially) tomorrow; morrow, next day.
from {{h2790}}; probably a hoe; share.
from {{h2790}}; probably a pick-axe; mattock.
from the same as {{h2716}}; a sink; draught house.
probably from {{h4229}}; erasure; Machath, the name of two Israelites; Mahath.
from {{h2834}}; a peeling; made appear.
from {{h2821}}; darkness; concretely, a dark place; dark(-ness, place).

or מַחֲשֶׁבֶת; from {{h2803}}; a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice); cunning (work), curious work, device(-sed), imagination, invented, means, purpose, thought.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4202}}; meat.
from {{h2109}}; food; meat, victual.
or מְזֻזָה; from the same as {{h2123}}; a door-post (as prominent); (door, side) post.
or (feminine) מִזְלָגָה; from an unused root meaning to draw up; a fork; fleshhook.
or מֵזַח; from {{h2118}}; a belt (as movable); girdle, strength.
or מָזֹר; from {{h2115}} in the sense of binding up; a bandage, i.e. remedy; hence, a sore (as needing a compress); bound up, wound.
from {{h2114}} in the sense of turning aside from truth; treachery, i.e. a plot; wound.
from {{h2161}}; a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity); (wicked) device, discretion, intent, witty invention, lewdness, mischievous (device), thought, wickedly.
apparently from {{h5140}} in the sense of raining; a constellation, i.e. Zodiacal sign (perhaps as affecting the weather); planet. Compare {{h4216}}.

or (feminine) מַטָּה; from {{h5186}}; a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread); rod, staff, tribe.
from {{h5786}} with directive enclitic appended; downward, below or beneath; often adverbially with or without prefixes; beneath, down(-ward), less, very low, under(-neath).
from {{h5186}}; a bed (as extended) for sleeping or eating; by analogy, a sofa, litter or bier; bed(-chamber), bier.
from {{h5186}}; a stretching, i.e. distortion (figuratively, iniquity); perverseness.
from {{h2864}}; a burglary; figuratively, unexpected examination; breaking up, secret search.
(Aramaic) or מְטָה; (Aramaic), apparently corresponding to {{h4672}} in the intransitive sense of being found present; to arrive, extend or happen; come, reach.
apparently a denominative from {{h2916}}; a broom (as removing dirt (compare English 'to dust', i.e. remove dust)); besom.
from {{h2873}}; slaughter; slaughter.
from {{h5186}}; expansion; stretching out.
from {{h2901}}; something spun; spun.
from {{h2232}}; a planted field; thing sown.
from {{h2236}}; a bowl (as if for sprinkling); bason, bowl.
from {{h2219}}; a winnowing shovel (as scattering the chaff); fan.
apparently from {{h2219}}; properly, a scatterer, i.e. the north wind (as dispersing clouds; only in plural); north.
apparently from {{h5144}} in the sense of distinction; some noted constellation (only in the plural), perhaps collectively, the zodiac; Mazzoroth. Compare {{h4208}}.
from {{h2224}}; sunrise, i.e. the east; east (side, -ward), (sun-) rising (of the sun).
from {{h2167}}; properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes; psalm.
from {{h2168}}; a pruning-knife; pruning-hook.
from {{h2168}}; a tweezer (only in the plural); snuffers.
from the same as {{h2191}}; fewness; by implication, as superlative diminutiveness; few, × very.
from {{h2629}}; a muzzle; bridle.
or מַחְסֶה; from {{h2620}}; a shelter (literally or figuratively); hope, (place of) refuge, shelter, trust.
from {{h2530}}; delightful; hence, a delight, i.e. object of affection or desire; beloved, desire, goodly, lovely, pleasant (thing).
a denominative from {{h2529}}; something buttery (i.e. unctuous and pleasant), as (figuratively) flattery; × than butter.
from {{h2550}}; (by paronomasia with {{h4261}}) delight; properly, sympathy; pitieth.
or מַחְמוּד; from {{h2530}}; desired; hence, a valuable; pleasant thing.
from {{h4264}} and {{h1835}}; camp of Dan; Machaneh-Dan, a place in Palestine; Mahaneh-dan.

from {{h2583}}; an encampment (of travellers or troops); hence, an army, whether literal (of soldiers) or figurative (of dancers, angels, cattle, locusts, stars; or even the sacred courts); army, band, battle, camp, company, drove, host, tents.
from {{h2614}}; choking; strangling.
dual of {{h4264}}; double camp; Machanajim, a place in Palestine; Mahanaim.
from {{h2713}}; properly, scrutinized, i.e. (by implication) a recess; deep place.
probably from {{h309}}; properly, deferred, i.e. the morrow; usually (adverbially) tomorrow; indefinitely, hereafter; time to come, tomorrow.
a primitive root; to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy; dip, pierce (through), smite (through), strike through, wound.
from {{h4272}}; a contusion; stroke.
or מַחְסֹר; from {{h2637}}; deficiency; hence, impoverishment; lack, need, penury, poor, poverty, want.
from {{h4268}} and {{h3050}}; refuge of (i.e. in) Jah; Machsejah, an Israelite; Maaseiah.
from {{h2673}}; a halving or the middle; half (so much), mid(-day).
a primitive root; to crush; smite off.
from {{h2672}}; properly, a hewing; concretely, a quarry; hewed(-n).
from {{h2673}}; a halving; half.
from {{h2490}}; a cavern (as if excavated); cave.
feminine of {{h4234}}; a dance; company, dances(-cing).
or (feminine) מַחֲלָה; from {{h2470}}; sickness; disease, infirmity, sickness.
from {{h2470}}; sickness; Machlah, the name apparently of two Israelitesses; Mahlah.
the same as {{h4242}}; price; Mechir, an Israelite; Mehir.
from an unused root meaning to buy; price, payment, wages; gain, hire, price, sold, worth.
from {{h2421}}; preservation of life; hence, sustenance; also the live flesh, i.e. the quick; preserve life, quick, recover selves, reviving, sustenance, victuals.
from {{h2330}}; junction; Mechida, one of the Nethinim; Mehida.
from {{h2470}}; sick; Machli, the name of two Israelites; Mahli.
from {{h2470}}; sick; Machlon, an Israelite; Mahlon.
patronymical from {{h4249}}; a Machlite or (collectively) descendants of Machli; Mahlites.
from {{h2470}}; a disease; disease.
from {{h2498}}; a (sacrificial) knife (as gliding through the flesh); knife.
from {{h2498}}; a ringlet of hair (as gliding over each other); lock.
from {{h2502}}; a mantle (as easily drawn off); changeable suit of apparel, change of raiment.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4256}}; a section (of the Levites); course.
from {{h2505}}; a section (of Levites, people or soldiers); company, course, division, portion. See also {{h5555}}.
from {{h2470}}; sickness; 'Machalath', probably the title (initial word) of a popular song; Mahalath.
the same as {{h4257}}; sickness; Machalath, the name of an Ishmaelitess and of an Israelitess; Mahalath.
patrial from {{h65}}; a Mecholathite or inhabitant of Abel-Mecholah; Mecholathite.
from {{h2266}}; a junction, i.e. seam or sewed piece; coupling.
or מַחֲבֹא; from {{h2244}}; a refuge; hiding (lurking) place.
from the same as {{h2281}}; a pan for baking in; pan.
from {{h2266}}; a joiner, i.e. brace or cramp; coupling, joining.
from the same as {{h4220}}; fat, i.e. marrow; marrow.
from {{h4229}} in the sense of greasing; fat; figuratively, rich; fatling (one).
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h4222}}; to strike in pieces; also to arrest; specifically to impale; hang, smite, stay.
a primitive root; to rub or strike the hands together (in exultation); clap.
from {{h2904}} in the sense of hammering out; an iron bar (as forged); bar.

a primitive root; properly, to stroke or rub; by implication, to erase; also to smooth (as if with oil), i.e. grease or make fat; also to touch, i.e. reach to; abolish, blot out, destroy, full of marrow, put out, reach unto, × utterly, wipe (away, out).
from {{h2296}}; a girdle; girding.
